com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics

Interface ZebraGraphicsI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ZebraGraphics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ZebraCardGraphics

    public interface ZebraGraphicsI
    Interface for all Zebra card printer graphics related tasks.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clear()
      Clears user set parameters.
      void close()
      Releases all the resources.
      byte[] convertImageToRGB(byte[] imageData)
      Converts the image to RGB format.
      ZebraCardImageI createImage()

      Crops an image to supplied dimensions and returns the cropped image data.

      Draws the image into the specified rectangle
      ExtractedImages extractBlackImageData(byte[] imageData, int redThreshold, int greenThreshold, int blueThreshold)
      Separates the monochrome and color data from the specified image data using the specified threshold values.
      byte[] extractHalfPanelImageData(byte[] imageData)
      Attempts to identify and extract the color and non-color half panel regions of the source image.
      void initialize(int maxWidth, int maxHeight, OrientationType orientation, PrintType printType, Integer fillColor)
      Initializes the drawing surface if the specified maxWidth or maxHeight is 0 then the maximum values for the specified printer model will be used

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(int maxWidth,
              int maxHeight,
              OrientationType orientation,
              PrintType printType,
              Integer fillColor)
        Initializes the drawing surface
        • if the specified maxWidth or maxHeight is 0 then the maximum values for the specified printer model will be used
        Parameters:
        maxWidth - the maximum width of the image (limited based on printer model).
        maxHeight - the maximum height of the image (limited based on printer model).
        orientation - the orientation of the image.
        printType - the type of print to be performed.
        fillColor - the RGB background fill color.

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(byte[] imageData,
             int x,
             int y,
             int width,
             int height,
             RotationType rotation)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      IllegalArgumentException
        Draws the image into the specified rectangle
        Parameters:
        imageData - the bitmap image data
        x - the x coordinate.
        y - the y coordinate.
        width - the width of the rectangle.
        • if 0 then the width of the specified image will be used
        height - the height of the rectangle.
        • if 0 then the height of the specified image will be used
        rotation - the rotation of the image.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading/writing.
        IllegalArgumentException - if an argument passed in is not valid.

      • cropImage

        byte[] cropImage(byte[] imageData,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Crops an image to supplied dimensions and returns the cropped image data.
        Parameters:
        imageData - byte[] containing the raw bitmap data.
        x - the x-offset of new image.
        y - the y-offset of new image.
        width - the width of the cropped image.
        height - the height of the cropped image.
        Returns:
        byte[] containing the cropped image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs reading the image data.

      • monochromeConversionType

        void monochromeConversionType(MonochromeConversion type)
        Sets the monochrome conversion type to be used during createImage().
        • Valid for ribbon types of 1bpp and 8bpp only.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of monochrome conversion to perform.

      • setBrightnessLevel

        void setBrightnessLevel(int level)
        Sets the brightness correction level to be applied during createImage()
        Parameters:
        level - the brightness level.
        • Range: -25 to 25
        • Values passed in (-25 to 25) will be converted to a range of -127 to 127 before being applied to each pixel (e.g. a value of 25 will correspond to an actual offset of 127).

      • setContrastLevel

        void setContrastLevel(int level)
        Sets the contrast correction level to be applied during createImage()
        Parameters:
        level - the contrast level.
        • Range: -25 to 25
        • Values passed in (-25 to 25) will be converted to a range of -127 to 127 before being applied to each pixel (e.g. a value of 25 will correspond to an actual offset of 127).

      • setGammaLevel

        void setGammaLevel(int level)
        Sets the gamma correction level to be applied during createImage()
        Parameters:
        level - the gamma level.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setSaturationLevel

        void setSaturationLevel(int level)
        Sets the saturation correction level to be applied during createImage()
        Parameters:
        level - the saturation correction level.
        • Range: -25 to 25

      • setColorScale

        void setColorScale(int red,
                 int green,
                 int blue)
        Sets the color scale correction values for red, green, and blue pixel values during createImage()
        Parameters:
        red - the red pixel correction value.
        green - the green pixel correction value.
        blue - the blue pixel correction value.
        • Range: -25 to 25
        • Values passed in (-25 to 25) will be converted to a range of -127 to 127 before being applied to each pixel (e.g. a value of 25 will correspond to an actual offset of 127).

      • createImage

        ZebraCardImageI createImage()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Generates the final bitmap image.
        Returns:
        ZebraCardImageI instance containing the bitmap image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading/writing.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears user set parameters.
        • Note: Will not reset parameters passed in during initialization

      • close

        void close()
        Releases all the resources.

      • rotateImage

        byte[] rotateImage(byte[] imageData,
                 RotationType type)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Rotates the image.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the source image data.
        type - the rotation type.
        Returns:
        byte[] the rotated image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading/writing.

      • rotateImage

        byte[] rotateImage(byte[] imageData,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 RotationType type)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Rotates the image and then resizes the image.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the source image data.
        width - the rotated image width.
        height - the rotated image height.
        type - the rotation type.
        Returns:
        byte[] the rotated image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading/writing.

      • convertImageToRGB

        byte[] convertImageToRGB(byte[] imageData)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Converts the image to RGB format.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the source image data.
        Returns:
        byte[] the RGB image data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs during reading/writing.

      • setPrinterModel

        void setPrinterModel(PrinterModel model)
        Sets the printer model.
        Parameters:
        model - the printer model type.

      • extractBlackImageData

        ExtractedImages extractBlackImageData(byte[] imageData,
                                    int redThreshold,
                                    int greenThreshold,
                                    int blueThreshold)
                                      throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                             java.io.IOException
        Separates the monochrome and color data from the specified image data using the specified threshold values.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the 24bpp bitmap color image data.
        redThreshold - the red pixel threshold value.
        • Range: 0 to 255
        greenThreshold - the green pixel threshold value.
        • Range: 0 to 255
        blueThreshold - the blue pixel threshold value.
        • Range: 0 to 255
        Returns:
        Images images instance containing the extracted color and monochrome image data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the redThreshold, greenThreshold, or blueThreshold level is outside of the valid range.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the image data.

      • extractHalfPanelImageData

        byte[] extractHalfPanelImageData(byte[] imageData)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                        java.io.IOException
        Attempts to identify and extract the color and non-color half panel regions of the source image.
        • ZMotif Series 7 and ZC Series printers only.
        • The printer model must be set prior to calling this method.
        Parameters:
        imageData - the 24bpp bitmap color image data.
        Returns:
        byte[] the extracted half panel color image data.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If imageData is invalid or the printer model is not supported.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while reading the image data.
